videoData.title: A solution to gun violence found in US history
videoData.socialTitle: A solution to gun violence found in US history

nodes.whoTheyAre: David Farrell saw his share of weapons during his service as a nuclear, biological and chemical warfare specialist during the first Gulf War. During that time, he was selected to help dispose of the WWII stockpile of chemical weapons. After his service, Farrell spent the next 20 years working as a customer service manager, professional stand-up comedian and presentation, leadership and life coach. Farrell joined UPS Cartage Services in 2013, using his knowledge of people and organizations to deliver excellent customer service to UPS’s clients in Hawaii. Farrell’s fascination with the history of gun legislation has led him to rethink the entire conversation about gun control.

videoData.description: Guns weren't always the contentious issue they are today in the US. Forty years ago, guns were primarily used for sport and recreation, and mass shootings were a rarity. Much has changed since then, and while there's a lot of debate around how to put an end to gun violence, there has yet to be a solution that everyone can agree on. Gun safety advocate David Farrell thinks he has the answer, and takes us through America's history to get there.
videoData.socialDescription: Guns weren't always the contentious issue they are today in the US. Forty years ago, guns were primarily used for sport and recreation, and mass shootings were a rarity.
